Detailed Description

template<typename Point, unsigned int Dim, typename NumType>
class ANN_W< Point, Dim, NumType >

ANN_W is a wrapper class for David Mounts ANN library. It uses ANN version 1.1.

The ANN algorithm is a wrapper class used to allow David Mount's nearest neighbor library ANN to share the same interface as the other NNCode implementations. It does not allow dynamic insertions or deletions, nor does it allow parallel queries. (These were limitations in the original ANN code). It operates out-of-place, meaning the data set is copied into ANNs internal data structure. It has a query time of O(ln(N)), a construction time of O(N), and a space requirement of O(N). ANN is the fastest implementation for non-parallel operation. If multiple queries can be made simultaneously, SFCNN is faster given 2 or more processors.

To include ANN in an application, use ANN_W.hpp
In addition, ANN must be compiled via the make utility located in the ANN directory. The path to the ANN header files is ANN/include/ANN, and the path to the ANN object files is ANN/src/
For an example of how to compile an application that uses ANN, see the Compiling a Sample Program section.

Searches for the k nearest neighbors to the point q

Parameters:
*q The query point
k The number of neighbors to return
nn_idx Vector of pointers to points, stores the solution
eps Error tolerence, default of 0.0. Answers will fit in a ball defined by radius*(1.0+eps)
sl Unused, for backwards compatibility
